name: Point of View and Consistent Person
description: Consistency in narrative person and tense across paragraphs

theory.natural_language: A memoir chapter must stay in first person singular past tense. Using third person breaks immersion. Switching to present tense mid-story is flagged. Paragraph A says 'I walked along the pier and remembered summer'. Paragraph B says 'He walks into the room and sees the map'. Paragraph C says 'I walked into the room and saw the map'.

queries.natural_language: Is paragraph A consistent with the memoir voice?

expected_answer.natural_language: Yes. It is first person singular and past tense as required.
expected_answer.explanation: paragraphA USES first_person_singular ∧ paragraphA USES past_tense

queries.natural_language: Does paragraph B violate the style rules?

expected_answer.natural_language: Yes. It switches to third person and present tense, breaking immersion.
expected_answer.explanation: paragraphB USES third_person ∧ third_person BREAKS_IMMERSION true

expected_answer.natural_language: Yes. It matches first person singular and past tense.
expected_answer.explanation: paragraphC USES first_person_singular ∧ paragraphC USES past_tense
